intro: Carex abscondita var. glauca, commonly known as the blue-green sedge, is a variant of the Carex abscondita species. It is a perennial herbaceous plant native to certain regions of North America. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves that are typically a bluish-green in color, giving it its common name. It thrives in moist to wet environments, such as marshes and along stream banks. The inflorescence consists of a spike of small, three-ranked flowers, typical of the Cyperaceae family.
